meanings.definition: A device consisting of a circular canopy on a folding metal frame supported by a central rod, used as protection against rain or sunlight.
meanings.sent1: During the storm, people opened their umbrellas to stay dry.
meanings.sent2: She always carries an umbrella in her bag in case it rains.
meanings.sent3: The umbrella tried to shield the sun but ended up getting sunburned.
meanings.sent4: Her umbrella of protection kept her safe from the harsh realities of life.
meanings.sent5: The colorful umbrella danced in the wind, a cheerful sight on a gloomy day.

meanings.definition: A thing that includes or contains many different elements or parts.
meanings.sent1: The report presented a complex umbrella of issues that needed to be addressed.
meanings.sent2: The project umbrella covered various aspects of the company's operations.
meanings.sent3: The umbrella of responsibilities seemed overwhelming at first, but she managed to handle them all.
meanings.sent4: Under the umbrella of creativity, artists explored new techniques and styles.
meanings.sent5: The umbrella of knowledge expanded as she delved deeper into her studies.
